values.description: I started a [gazebo-default-doc job](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-default-doc/124/) and it's taking a long time on the jenkins master (over 3 hours at this point). This PR disables test compilation, so it should be a bit faster.

values.description:
Gazebo [pull request 1835](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/1835/hotkey-chart/diff) adds `QtWebKit` as a dependency, which [fails](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/412/console) to build on jenkins probably because `libqtwebkit-dev` is a recommended package but is not installed.

It [seems](http://packages.ubuntu.com/search?keywords=libqtwebkit-dev) to be on Ubuntu since Precise, so hopefully it won't break anything.

There's a possibility this won't fix the problem. If we find out later that this wasn't needed I'll make another pull request to revert the changes.
values.title: Add libqtwebkit-dev as a dependency

summary.raw:
Gazebo [pull request 1835](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/1835/hotkey-chart/diff) adds `QtWebKit` as a dependency, which [fails](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/412/console) to build on jenkins probably because `libqtwebkit-dev` is a recommended package but is not installed.

It [seems](http://packages.ubuntu.com/search?keywords=libqtwebkit-dev) to be on Ubuntu since Precise, so hopefully it won't break anything.

There's a possibility this won't fix the problem. If we find out later that this wasn't needed I'll make another pull request to revert the changes.
summary.html:
Gazebo pull request 1835 adds QtWebKit as a dependency, which fails to build on jenkins probably because libqtwebkit-dev is a recommended package but is not installed.

It seems to be on Ubuntu since Precise, so hopefully it won't break anything.

There's a possibility this won't fix the problem. If we find out later that this wasn't needed I'll make another pull request to revert the changes.

values.description:
First implementation of GPU support to migrate GPU needed tests to docker.

Still need to debug a [failure in RayTest with libgl](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-default-devel-trusty-amd64-docker_test/57), but the rest of it seems to work fine.

Need to merge this testing support ASAP, there is no change for all the testing jobs that are currently working with pbuilder, so no errors should reach our CI pipeline.
values.title: Implement GPU docker gazebo instances

summary.raw:
First implementation of GPU support to migrate GPU needed tests to docker.

Still need to debug a [failure in RayTest with libgl](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-default-devel-trusty-amd64-docker_test/57), but the rest of it seems to work fine.

Need to merge this testing support ASAP, there is no change for all the testing jobs that are currently working with pbuilder, so no errors should reach our CI pipeline.
summary.html:
First implementation of GPU support to migrate GPU needed tests to docker.

Still need to debug a failure in RayTest with libgl, but the rest of it seems to work fine.

Need to merge this testing support ASAP, there is no change for all the testing jobs that are currently working with pbuilder, so no errors should reach our CI pipeline.

values.description:
This pull request implements the ROS 1.0 cygwin ci script. This is particularly interesting since it uses jenkins DSL to create the `roscygwin-ci_daily-cygwin64` jenkins job (configuration as code).

 * The `roscywgin_compilation.dsl` acts as a seed. The [_dsl_roscygwin](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ros/view/ros_cygwin/job/_dsl_roscygwin/) jenkins job was configured manually and run the `jenkins-scripts/cygwin/dsl/roscywgin_compilation.dsl`.
 * The [roscygwin-ci_daily-cygwin64](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ros/view/ros_cygwin/job/roscygwin-ci_daily-cygwin64) is automatically generated and should not be manually modified. Once it is created, if we run again the dsl seed, the configuration will be updated and all the history kept.
 * The good thing is that we can embed groovy code into the dsl file to create any number of jobs and shared code between the jenkins jobs configurations.
values.title: First use of jenkins DSL: ros-cygwin implementation

summary.raw:

 * The `roscywgin_compilation.dsl` acts as a seed. The [_dsl_roscygwin](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ros/view/ros_cygwin/job/_dsl_roscygwin/) jenkins job was configured manually and run the `jenkins-scripts/cygwin/dsl/roscywgin_compilation.dsl`.
 * The [roscygwin-ci_daily-cygwin64](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ros/view/ros_cygwin/job/roscygwin-ci_daily-cygwin64) is automatically generated and should not be manually modified. Once it is created, if we run again the dsl seed, the configuration will be updated and all the history kept.
 * The good thing is that we can embed groovy code into the dsl file to create any number of jobs and shared code between the jenkins jobs configurations.
summary.html:
This pull request implements the ROS 1.0 cygwin ci script. This is particularly interesting since it uses jenkins DSL to create the roscygwin-ci_daily-cygwin64 jenkins job (configuration as code).

  • The roscywgin_compilation.dsl acts as a seed. The _dsl_roscygwin jenkins job was configured manually and run the jenkins-scripts/cygwin/dsl/roscywgin_compilation.dsl.
  • The roscygwin-ci_daily-cygwin64 is automatically generated and should not be manually modified. Once it is created, if we run again the dsl seed, the configuration will be updated and all the history kept.
  • The good thing is that we can embed groovy code into the dsl file to create any number of jobs and shared code between the jenkins jobs configurations.

values.description:
This PRs implements the first class structure that help to share jenkins configuration among all our jobs. It is based on an inheritance structure that defines configurations in different levels. For example, the Linux CI compilation jobs inherit properties from OSRFBase (mail and description) and OSRFLinux (ansi color, docker label, release tool checkout, ...).

```
               OSRFBase
                     |
               ----------------
              |
       OSRFLinux
              |
       ----------------
       |
OSRFLinuxCompilation
```

This allows to implement a mentor2 branch testing job with just [a few lines](#!/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/new#chg-jenkins-scripts/dsl/mentor2.dsl).

Testing run: the [seed job](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/_dsl_mentor2/), and the [generated job](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/gazebo-ci_mentor2_v2-trusty-amd64/).
values.title: DSL classes for jenkins jobs - Mentor2 branch gazebo testing implementation

values.description:
First approach to keep docker cache under control. The check for space can be improved (checking the space used in root partition) but I was looking for something fast to run on every job.

Let's see how this goes and fine tuning the days for checking in the case of not working well.
values.title: Implement check and clean of old docker images

summary.raw:
First approach to keep docker cache under control. The check for space can be improved (checking the space used in root partition) but I was looking for something fast to run on every job.

Let's see how this goes and fine tuning the days for checking in the case of not working well.
summary.html:
First approach to keep docker cache under control. The check for space can be improved (checking the space used in root partition) but I was looking for something fast to run on every job.

Let's see how this goes and fine tuning the days for checking in the case of not working well.

values.description:
This PR implements the ability to handle different building methods when releasing packages depending on the information provided by the -release repositories. All the information about how to define and use this different methods is in the `debbuild-base.bash.doc.md` file (part of this PR). Backwards compatibility with current branches is preserved, no migration needed.

This allow the mentor project to use the default branches in sdformat3 and gazebo6 and just keep in the mentor branch (see the [mentor2 branch in sdformat](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat3-release/src/14c48e61c4242b4afd52f9ac3f2b67eeb8967703/?at=mentor2) the changelog and a simple patch, the rest is imported from default branch.

Testing runs:

 * [usual sdformat3 release from default](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat3-debbuilder_test_metadata_build/3/)
 * [sdformat3 mentor2 branch](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat3-debbuilder_test_metadata_build/2/)
values.title: Implement metadata for different pkg building methods: legacy and overwrite_base

values.title: Handsim GPU docker scripts

values.description:
This PR implement the ability for jenkins job of telling which OSRF repositories should docker use when building the environment. This is useful in some situations:

 * nightly building: currently only using ubuntu-stable and not getting the latest packages from nightly when building nightlies.  
 * mentor2: where we don't want the stable repo, just the mentor2 repository.

Backwards compatibility is kept by defaulting to stable and migrating USE_OSRF_REPO to OSRF_REPOS_TO_USE.

Testing run: the [install gazebo mentor package](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/mentor/view/mentor2/job/install-gazebo_mentor2-pkg-trusty-amd64/) job.
values.title: Support for using different OSRF repositories in jobs

values.description:
Refactoring current code to support more system: OsX and Win.

Groovy does not support multiple-inheritance but composition with static methods can be done without any problem.

The testing was done with [ignition-transport to implement](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/):

  * Main CI jobs: trusty on default check every 5 minutes
  * Other CI jobs: vivid, win, brew, check daily
  * debbuilder for generating the ubunut packages

I still need to migrate the -any- jobs and sdks.
values.title: DSL classes to create OsX and Win compilations

  * Main CI jobs: trusty on default check every 5 minutes
  * Other CI jobs: vivid, win, brew, check daily

values.description:
This is a first part of the procedure to update homebrew formulae as a consequence of the `release.py` script. Currently we create and upload tarballs. This PR also computes a sha256 of the tarball and passes it as a parameter to the jenkins jobs.

Hopefully it won't break existing jobs to receive an unexpected parameter.

After this PR, we should create a new jenkins job that takes 3 parameters:

* package name (with major revision if applicable, ie `sdformat3`)
* tarball URI
* tarball sha256

That jenkins job should do the following:

* `git clone https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation`
* modify the requested formula
* commit and push to a fork / branch
* create a pull request against `osrf/homebrew-simulation`

I think that would be a good start.
values.title: Compute sha256 for generated tarballs and pass to jenkins jobs

After this PR, we should create a new jenkins job that takes 3 parameters:

That jenkins job should do the following:

summary.html:
This is a first part of the procedure to update homebrew formulae as a consequence of the release.py script. Currently we create and upload tarballs. This PR also computes a sha256 of the tarball and passes it as a parameter to the jenkins jobs.

Hopefully it won't break existing jobs to receive an unexpected parameter.

After this PR, we should create a new jenkins job that takes 3 parameters:

  • package name (with major revision if applicable, ie sdformat3)
  • tarball URI
  • tarball sha256

That jenkins job should do the following:

  • git clone https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation
  • modify the requested formula
  • commit and push to a fork / branch
  • create a pull request against osrf/homebrew-simulation

I think that would be a good start.

values.description:
This implements the jenkins DSL to build -any- jobs in Linux, Mac and Windows.

To test the new jobs, I've implemented all the ignition transport jobs needed:
http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/_dsl_ignition/

As soon as I've merge this PR I will disable the old manually created jenkins jobs and adapt the bitbucket<->jenkins daemon to use these new ones.
values.title: Implement ANY jobs in DSL - Migrate ignition-transport

To test the new jobs, I've implemented all the ignition transport jobs needed:
http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/_dsl_ignition/

As soon as I've merge this PR I will disable the old manually created jenkins jobs and adapt the bitbucket<->jenkins daemon to use these new ones.

values.description:
This PR implements the [DSL](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/robocup3ds/job/_dsl_robocup3ds/) to create all the [jenkins jobs for robocup3ds](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/robocup3ds/), which include:

 * Usual testing on default branch for supported distributions
 * pr_any job to be used as part of the CI workflow
 * linux package builder
 * Automatic testing of the one_line installation on supported distributions

summary.raw:
This PR implements the [DSL](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/robocup3ds/job/_dsl_robocup3ds/) to create all the [jenkins jobs for robocup3ds](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/robocup3ds/), which include:

 * Usual testing on default branch for supported distributions
 * pr_any job to be used as part of the CI workflow
 * linux package builder
 * Automatic testing of the one_line installation on supported distributions
summary.html:
This PR implements the DSL to create all the jenkins jobs for robocup3ds, which include:

  • Usual testing on default branch for supported distributions
  • pr_any job to be used as part of the CI workflow
  • linux package builder
  • Automatic testing of the one_line installation on supported distributions

values.description:
Introduce new variable LINUX_DISTRO, default to ubuntu. Support for debian distributions inside docker.

Two different kind of jobs are created from this DSL:

 * pkg_builder: changes in the debian git, try to build the package and run lintian checker.
 * install: once a week try to install debian packages to check that are ok.
values.title: DSL: debian scripts to help with maintenance of packages

summary.raw:
Introduce new variable LINUX_DISTRO, default to ubuntu. Support for debian distributions inside docker.

Two different kind of jobs are created from this DSL:

 * pkg_builder: changes in the debian git, try to build the package and run lintian checker.
 * install: once a week try to install debian packages to check that are ok.
summary.html:
Introduce new variable LINUX_DISTRO, default to ubuntu. Support for debian distributions inside docker.

Two different kind of jobs are created from this DSL:

  • pkg_builder: changes in the debian git, try to build the package and run lintian checker.
  • install: once a week try to install debian packages to check that are ok.

values.description:
This pull request updates `dependencies.sh` for gazebo 6.

I tried to install the dependencies of gazebo 6 according to the instruction in the [tutorial page](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=install_from_source&ver=default&cat=install) but got an following error.
```
js@js:~$ ROS_DISTRO=dummy . /tmp/dependencies.sh
js@js:~$ sudo apt-get install $(sed 's:\\ ::g' <<< $GAZEBO_BASE_DEPENDENCIES) $(sed 's:\\ ::g' <<< $BASE_DEPENDENCIES)
Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree       
Reading state information... Done
E: Unable to locate package libsdformat2-dev
```

I could resolve this error by specifying `GAZEBO_MAJOR_VERSION` as:
```
js@js:~$ ROS_DISTRO=dummy GAZEBO_MAJOR_VERSION=6 . /tmp/dependencies.sh
```

However, I think it would make more sense if `dependencies.sh` installs the dependencies of gazebo 6 by default when the major version is not specified since the gazebo version in the default branch is 6.

If the default version is set to 5 on purpose, then it would be good to comment that `GAZEBO_MAJOR_VERSION` should be specified for gazebo 6 build in the tutorial.
values.title: Update dependencies_archive.sh for gazebo 6

summary.raw:
This pull request updates `dependencies.sh` for gazebo 6.

I tried to install the dependencies of gazebo 6 according to the instruction in the [tutorial page](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=install_from_source&ver=default&cat=install) but got an following error.
```
js@js:~$ ROS_DISTRO=dummy . /tmp/dependencies.sh
js@js:~$ sudo apt-get install $(sed 's:\\ ::g' <<< $GAZEBO_BASE_DEPENDENCIES) $(sed 's:\\ ::g' <<< $BASE_DEPENDENCIES)
Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree       
Reading state information... Done
E: Unable to locate package libsdformat2-dev
```

I could resolve this error by specifying `GAZEBO_MAJOR_VERSION` as:
```
js@js:~$ ROS_DISTRO=dummy GAZEBO_MAJOR_VERSION=6 . /tmp/dependencies.sh
```

However, I think it would make more sense if `dependencies.sh` installs the dependencies of gazebo 6 by default when the major version is not specified since the gazebo version in the default branch is 6.

If the default version is set to 5 on purpose, then it would be good to comment that `GAZEBO_MAJOR_VERSION` should be specified for gazebo 6 build in the tutorial.
summary.html:
This pull request updates dependencies.sh for gazebo 6.

I tried to install the dependencies of gazebo 6 according to the instruction in the tutorial page but got an following error.

js@js:~$ ROS_DISTRO=dummy . /tmp/dependencies.sh
js@js:~$ sudo apt-get install $(sed 's:\\ ::g' <<< $GAZEBO_BASE_DEPENDENCIES) $(sed 's:\\ ::g' <<< $BASE_DEPENDENCIES)
Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree       
Reading state information... Done
E: Unable to locate package libsdformat2-dev

I could resolve this error by specifying GAZEBO_MAJOR_VERSION as:

js@js:~$ ROS_DISTRO=dummy GAZEBO_MAJOR_VERSION=6 . /tmp/dependencies.sh

However, I think it would make more sense if dependencies.sh installs the dependencies of gazebo 6 by default when the major version is not specified since the gazebo version in the default branch is 6.

If the default version is set to 5 on purpose, then it would be good to comment that GAZEBO_MAJOR_VERSION should be specified for gazebo 6 build in the tutorial.

values.description:
This PRs implement [jenkins-dsl for all our sdformat jobs (up to 24 jobs)](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_dsl_sdformat-gazebo/), which includes:

  * sdformat compilation ci jobs: linux, mac and windows
  * sdformat compilation of supported branches
  * sdformat debbuilder jobs
  * sdformat abi checker (it is automatically called from ci-pr_any when DEST_BRANCH != default)
  * sdformat performance job
values.title: DSL: migrate sdformat. Implement ABI and Performance classes

  * sdformat compilation of supported branches

  * sdformat performance job
